author: Get News
title: Beverly Builders Group Unveils Top-Notch Room Addition Services for North Hollywood Residents | dailytimesleader.com | Serving West Point & Clay County Since 1867
text:
Beverly Builders Group, a reputable construction company based in North Hollywood, CA, is pleased to announce its top-notch room addition services. With years of experience in the industry, Beverly Builders Group has earned a reputation for delivering excellence in craftsmanship and customer satisfaction.
A room addition is an excellent way to expand your living space without the hassle of moving. Whether you need an extra bedroom, a home office, a playroom, or any other type of additional space, Beverly Builders Group has the expertise to bring your vision to life.
"Our goal at Beverly Builders Group is to provide our clients with seamless room additions that not only meet but exceed their expectations," said a spokesperson for the company. "We understand that every client has unique needs and preferences, and we work closely with them to create personalized solutions that enhance their living space."
Beverly Builders Group offers a comprehensive range of room addition services, including:
Design and Planning: Collaborating with clients to create customized room addition designs that seamlessly integrate with the existing structure and complement the overall aesthetics of the home.
Permitting and Regulatory Compliance: Handling all necessary permits and ensuring compliance with local building codes and regulations, ensuring a smooth and hassle-free construction process.
Construction: Employing a team of skilled craftsmen who use high-quality materials and industry-leading techniques to construct room additions that are built to last.
Electrical and Plumbing: Integrating electrical and plumbing systems seamlessly into the new space to ensure functionality and convenience.
Interior Finishes: Assisting clients in selecting finishes, such as flooring, paint, and fixtures, that align with their style and preferences.
Beverly Builders Group takes pride in its commitment to customer satisfaction. They understand that a room addition is a significant investment, and they strive to deliver exceptional results within the agreed-upon timeline and budget. Their team of experts works diligently to ensure that every aspect of the room addition project is executed with precision and professionalism.
For more information about Beverly Builders Group's room addition services or to schedule a consultation, please visit https://beverlybuildersgroup.com/ - https://beverlybuildersgroup.wordpress.com/2023/12/28/press-release-oct-home-remodeling/ or contact us at (818) 724-7744.
About Beverly Builders Group:
Beverly Builders Group is a renowned construction company based in North Hollywood, CA. With a strong focus on quality craftsmanship and customer satisfaction, Beverly Builders Group specializes in providing top-notch room addition services. They are committed to delivering exceptional results that transform their clients' homes and enhance their living spaces.

author: Diego Bastarrica
title: Por qué los viajeros frecuentes no deberían comprar los AirPods Max USB-C | Digital Trends Español
text:
Cuando Apple anunció una versión actualizada de sus auriculares inalámbricos con cancelación de ruido AirPods Max a principios de este año, anticipaba algunos cambios muy necesarios, como una carcasa rediseñada, un peso más ligero y una forma de escuchar audio sin pérdidas. En su lugar, obtuvimos la carga USB-C (útil, pero no trascendental) y un lote de nuevas opciones de color. No es exactamente la actualización que esperaba.
No voy a llover en el desfile de Apple y decirte que evites por completo los AirPods Max actualizados. Para muchas personas, el cambio a USB-C podría ser la única razón por la que necesitan comprarlos, especialmente si han podido purgar el resto de sus vidas de dispositivos equipados con Lightning.
Recommended Videos Sin embargo, recomiendo firmemente que si eres un viajero frecuente, o estás pensando en un regalo para alguien que lo es, te mantengas alejado de los AirPods Max actualizados. Al menos por ahora. He aquí por qué:
Related Los AirPods 4 de Apple agregan ANC asequible y carga inalámbrica ¿Qué cosa? ¿que los AirPods tendrán una cámara? Por qué deberías comprar el iPhone 15 Pro Max en lugar del iPhone 15 Pro Eventualmente, Bluetooth estará disponible en todos los sistemas de entretenimiento de los respaldos de los asientos. Algunos de esos sistemas incluso pueden usar Auracast para facilitar aún más la escucha inalámbrica (no se requiere emparejamiento Bluetooth). Pero ese día todavía está muchos años en el futuro. Para la mayoría de los viajeros, conectar los auriculares a la toma de 3,5 mm disponible (o a la temida conexión dual) sigue siendo la norma.
Los AirPods Max originales equipados con Lightning no se enviaron con un cable de entrada de audio analógico de 3.5 mm, pero Apple puso a disposición uno como accesorio opcional de $ 35. Desafortunadamente, no existe tal accesorio para la versión USB-C actualizada de los AirPods Max. Déjame decirlo de otra manera: los nuevos AirPods Max solo se conectan a través de Bluetooth.
Los Sonos Ace vienen con un cable de 3,5 mm a USB-C. Simon Cohen / DT Me puse en contacto con Apple para averiguar si tal vez se está trabajando en un cable de 3,5 mm a USB-C. Después de todo, hemos visto auriculares USB-C de Bowers & Wilkins, Master & Dynamic y Sonos que vienen con estos cables, por lo que no estamos hablando de una tecnología exótica que nadie ha creado todavía. A partir de la publicación de esta publicación, no he recibido respuesta.
La buena noticia, si se puede llamar así, es que todavía tiene una opción de entretenimiento a bordo incluso si compra los AirPods Max USB-C. De hecho, es la misma opción que los propietarios de AirPods y AirPods Pro de Apple han tenido durante años: comprar un transmisor Bluetooth portátil y empacarlo en su equipaje de mano.
Los transmisores Bluetooth son dongles alimentados por batería que se conectan a una fuente analógica (como un sistema de respaldo de asiento, el conector de auriculares de un televisor o una salida similar de 3,5 mm en una variedad de otros dispositivos) y luego envía el audio a un conjunto emparejado de auriculares inalámbricos o audífonos. Algunos transmisores le permiten emparejar dos de estos dispositivos simultáneamente.
Con las ofertas del Black Friday a la vuelta de la esquina, probablemente sea un buen momento para comprar un transmisor, pero eso no viene al caso: no debería necesitarlo cuando compra un par de auriculares inalámbricos caros y emblemáticos de una empresa como Apple.
Recomendaciones del editor Por qué la mejor función nueva de los AirPods Pro está prohibida en más de 100 países Los tipos de Apple Airpods que puedes comprar en la actualidad Por qué deberías comprar el iPhone 15 Pro en lugar del iPhone 15 Pro Max Por qué deberías comprar un MacBook Pro en lugar de un MacBook Air Por qué deberías comprar un MacBook Air en lugar de un MacBook Pro

author: AB Newswire
title: Revolutionizing Landscapes: The Surge in Artificial Grass Installation | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Artificial grass installation is not limited to residential lawns. It is also gaining popularity in a variety of other settings. Sports fields and recreational areas, for instance, have long been utilizing artificial turf due to its durability and ability to withstand heavy use. Schools, parks, and playgrounds are increasingly turning to artificial grass to provide safe and clean play areas for children. The surge in demand for artificial grass installation is reshaping how homeowners and businesses approach landscaping. The advantages of artificial turf are becoming increasingly clear, leading to a growing number of installations across various properties. This shift is driven by a combination of economic, environmental, and aesthetic factors.
The Appeal of Artificial Turf
Artificial turf offers numerous benefits that natural grass simply cannot match. One of the most significant advantages is its low maintenance requirements. Unlike natural grass, which demands regular watering, mowing, and fertilizing, artificial grass stays green and lush with minimal upkeep. This is particularly appealing in regions like Arizona, where water conservation is a critical concern.
Additionally, artificial grass provides a consistent appearance throughout the year. Natural grass can suffer from patchiness, discoloration, and weed invasions, especially in extreme weather conditions. In contrast, artificial grass maintains its vibrant look regardless of the season, ensuring a visually appealing landscape at all times.
Environmental and Economic Benefits
The environmental benefits of artificial grass installation are substantial. Water conservation is a top priority in many areas, and artificial grass significantly reduces the need for irrigation. This not only conserves a precious natural resource but also translates to lower water bills for homeowners and businesses. In a region like Arizona, where drought conditions are common, this can make a significant impact.
Moreover, artificial turf eliminates the need for chemical fertilizers and pesticides, which can have harmful effects on the environment. By opting for artificial grass, property owners contribute to a healthier ecosystem while enjoying a beautiful and low-maintenance landscape.
From an economic perspective, the initial investment in artificial grass can be offset by the long-term savings on maintenance and water costs. Over time, the reduced need for lawn care services, equipment, and water usage can lead to significant financial benefits. This makes artificial grass a cost-effective solution for both residential and commercial properties.
Applications of Artificial Grass
Artificial grass installation is not limited to residential lawns. It is also gaining popularity in a variety of other settings. Sports fields and recreational areas, for instance, have long been utilizing artificial turf due to its durability and ability to withstand heavy use. Schools, parks, and playgrounds are increasingly turning to artificial grass to provide safe and clean play areas for children.
Commercial properties are also recognizing the advantages of artificial grass. Office complexes, retail centers, and hospitality establishments are incorporating artificial turf into their landscaping to create inviting and attractive outdoor spaces. The low maintenance requirements and aesthetic appeal make it an ideal choice for businesses looking to enhance their curb appeal without incurring high upkeep costs.
Always Green Turf AZ: Leading the Way in Artificial Grass Installation
As the demand for artificial grass continues to rise, companies specializing in its installation are playing a crucial role in meeting this demand. Always Green Turf AZ is at the forefront of this industry, providing top-quality artificial grass installation services to a diverse range of clients.
Always Green Turf AZ stands out for its commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction. The company offers a wide selection of artificial turf products, ensuring that clients can find the perfect solution for their specific needs. Whether it's a residential lawn, a commercial property, or a recreational facility, Always Green Turf AZ has the expertise and resources to deliver outstanding results.
The company's team of skilled artificial grass installers is dedicated to ensuring that every project is completed to the highest standards. From the initial consultation to the final installation, Always Green Turf AZ prioritizes quality and attention to detail. This dedication has earned them a reputation as one of the leading artificial grass installation providers in the region.
The Future of Landscaping
The growing popularity of artificial grass is indicative of a broader trend towards sustainable and low-maintenance landscaping solutions. As more property owners recognize the benefits of artificial turf, the demand for professional installation services is expected to continue rising. Companies like Always Green Turf AZ are well-positioned to capitalize on this trend, offering innovative solutions that cater to the evolving needs of their clients.
In conclusion, the surge in artificial grass installation is transforming landscapes across residential, commercial, and recreational settings. The benefits of artificial turf, including low maintenance, environmental sustainability, and cost savings, make it an attractive choice for property owners. With companies like Always Green Turf AZ leading the way, the future of landscaping looks greener and more sustainable than ever.

author: Stephen Rivers
title: Fisker Ocean Finally Gets A Win By Thrashing A VW Golf R At U-Drag Race
text: - The Fisker Ocean has a significant power advantage as it delivers 468 hp to the Golf R’s 315. - Despite that, the VW is much lighter and thus has a better power-to-weight ratio. - U-drag racing results aren’t as close as one might imagine though. There likely aren’t too many folks cross-shopping the [Fisker Ocean](https://www.carscoops.com/tag/fisker-ocean/) and the Volkswagen Golf R. Not only are they not truly in the same segment, one being a hot hatch and one being an electric SUV, but the Ocean is deep amid [a lot of bankruptcy drama](https://www.carscoops.com/2024/08/fisker-avoids-chapter-7-liquidation-owners-will-continue-to-get-support-for-their-vehicles/). In any case, watching them race reveals a lot about modern-day performance. This competition is interesting because it tests acceleration, braking, handling, and high-speed power output. Known simply as the U-Drag, it begins with both cars competing in a traditional drag race. Then, after they reach the quarter-mile marker, they have to brake, turn around, and get back to the start line as fast as possible. Read: [Hyundai Ioniq 5 N Vs BMW M4 Competition Isn’t Much Of A Competition](https://www.carscoops.com/2024/07/hyundai-ioniq-5-n-vs-bmw-m4-competition-isnt-much-of-a-competition/) On paper, the Golf R is no pushover as one might have thought. Sure, it makes 315 horsepower and 295 lb-ft of torque, which is significantly less than the 468 horsepower and 514 lb-ft of torque of the Fisker. However, the Golf R weighs 3,455 lbs (1,567 kg), while the Ocean tips the scales at 5,364 lbs (2,433 kg), and thus Wolfsburg’s hot hatch has a better power-to-weight ratio. In the real world, things look good for the Volkswagen for the first few seconds of the race. After that, though, it’s all [Fisker.](https://www.carscoops.com/tag/fisker/) The Ocean surges past the Golf, wins the first drag race, and beats the VW into the corner too. Both cars manage the bend at a similar pace but the Ocean is simply too fast for the Golf to keep up. Race two goes largely the same way, so let’s take a quick look at the numbers to break down how the Fisker won these races. The VW launches harder but by the time each car is at 60 mph, the Ocean is ahead. It needed just 4.2 seconds to reach that speed compared to 4.6 for the VW. In the quarter of a mile, the Ocean won by finishing in 12.4 seconds versus the Golf at 12.9. Even the handling g-force measurements proved the Ocean performed better with a lateral force of 1.01 G compared to the 1.00 of the [VW](https://www.carscoops.com/tag/vw/). How is all of that possible given the numbers on paper? Don’t forget that the Ocean keeps much of its weight super-low in the chassis. That makes a big difference when it comes to cornering speed. In addition, it might have more weight to handle per horsepower but, being an EV, its power is almost instantly available and sustainable, unlike its ICE-powered rival.

author: Philip S. Chua, MD
title: AI – friend or foe
text:
‘In clinical medical practice, AI would be a masterful aid, which could expedite diagnosis and rapidly suggest treatments…’
ONE of the greatest human innovations introduced in recent times is Artificial Intelligence, crude forms of which have actually been around for centuries. The recent field of AI research started in 1956 at the Darthmouth Summer Research Project. Still a controversial matter, AI, a double-edge sword, could cut both ways. The vast benefits artificial intelligence could provide the world are immense, but it also poses a lot of danger, especially in the hands of bad actors. Some of them are job displacement, economic inequality, security concerns, loss of human connection, data collection, misinformation, bias, improper disclosure of personal data, lack of accessibility, unforeseen and unintended consequences, abuse and misuse, and existential risk, wrong or unsafe decisions and outcomes from AI machines, which fears Elon Musk of Space X and Tesla has expressed.
One recent example is California’s passage of a bill (SB 1120) last month “ensuring that physicians, not artificial intelligence (AI) have the final say on patients’ treatment and services, including insurance-required prior authorization.’” Review of a significant number of AI decisions on this matter revealed that AI decisions had been erroneous, leading to delay and denial of diagnoses and treatments among some seniors, contributing to some deaths.
Artificial intelligence for our homes, garages, offices, cars, personal gadgets (computers, tablets, phones etc.), and security devices are magnificent and beneficial, even addictive. We are so dependent on them and are blessed to have them today. But their misuse and abuse are already evident, especially in social media and in the hands of criminals.
In clinical medical practice, AI would be a masterful aid, which could expedite diagnosis and rapidly suggest treatments, but this mechanical-electrical, algorithmic-controlled cold “humanoid” will never have human warmth, empathy, and spirit.
While AI is excellent in countless ways, human intelligence and human touch are still superior because of our five basic senses and instincts coupled with our inherent ability to love, feel compassion, and desire for justice.
So, we, humans, can either create and utilize AI to be a monster to hurt people or society for selfish or diabolical reasons, or even destroy mankind, or develop it wisely to make the whole world a better place, a more convenient, healthier, more productive, more secure, and happier habitat for all of us, earthlings. Let’s see how intelligent and wise, or stupid we, humans, really are.
Lectins, gluten Studies have shown that lectins (in legumes and grains) and glutens (in wheat products, like bread) are unhealthy substances also found in food items like oatmeal, tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants, paprika, peppers, spinach, kale, some fruits, etc., items we used to think were healthy for us.
Lectins and glutens are proteins that could disrupt digestion by binding to, and destroying, the lining of our intestines, causing leaky gut syndrome, allowing bacteria to seep into our bloodstream. They could cause inflammation and obesity and could also damage our immune system. Soaking (in acid medium, like lemon juice, buttermilk, yogurt) and cooking at high temperature will reduce lectins and glutens. Make sure to read food labels (or Google food ingredients) to make sure you are eating healthy. While quantity (caloric control) is important, quality of foods we eat is also vital.
Aluminum dangers Aluminum has been a part of our life since 1903 when it was first introduced in France. In 1911, this material was used in Bern, Switzerland, for wrapping chocolate bars. In 1926, the US Foil Company (parent company of Reynolds Metals) launched this tin foil, which became an instant hit.
Anyway, studies have now revealed that aluminum has detrimental health effects as a neurotoxin, linked to Alzheimer’s, bone disease, and pulmonary fibrosis, among other still undiscovered side effects.
Hot food items wrapped in tin foil could conceivably contaminate the food. Using aluminum cookware and aluminum accessories in the kitchen is also unsafe. Aluminum could leach into foods.
Safer alternatives include using stainless steel, glass, and ceramic cook wares, utensils, and dinner wares.
Vitamin D3 warning One of the most popular and beneficial vitamins today is D3, a nutrient our body needs for building and maintaining healthy bones, to prevent osteoporosis, for one. It also regulates many cellular functions in us and has anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and neuroprotective qualities that support our brain cell activity, immune health, and muscle function.
Vitamin D is not found naturally in many food items but present in fortified milk, cereal, and fatty fishes, like salmon, sardines, mackerel. Exposure to sunlight also converts a chemical in our skin into an active form of calciferol (Vitamin D). During winter months, with less sunlight, vitamin D production might be less or nil. Sunscreen, obviously, while important to prevent skin cancer, also decreases vitamin D production.
The latest from the FDA and medical centers, like the Mayo Clinic, Harvard, based on updated guidelines from multiple studies from the Endocrine Society, reported in August 2024 in The Journal of Clinical Endocrinology and metabolism is that the recommended daily amount of vitamin D is 400 international units (IU) for children up to age 12 months, 600 IU for people ages 1 to 70 years, and 800 IU for people over 70 years.
While taking vitamin D3 is generally safe, some side effects of overdosing can include nausea, vomiting, constipation, poor appetite and unwanted weight loss, weaknesses, confusion, disorientation, heart rhythm disturbances, kidney stones and renal damage. Vitamin D could interact with many medications.
Before embarking on any health strategy, including adding vitamins or supplements to your current regimen, discuss your plans with your physician because any of these might interact with your medications or cause potential serious complications.

author: VNExplorer
title: In otter news, orphaned B.C. pup is thriving but unlikely to return to wild
text: The sea otter pup rescued in critical condition just weeks ago in British Columbia, shown in a handout photo, is thriving under 24-hour care at Vancouver Aquarium's Marine Mammal Rescue Centre.THE CANADIAN PRESS/HO-Vancouver Aquarium Marine Mammal Rescue Society **MANDATORY CREDIT** VANCOUVER — An orphaned sea otter pup rescued in critical condition in British Columbia last month is thriving under 24-hour care, but a veterinarian at the rescue facility says it's unlikely she will ever be able to return to the wild. The female pup, named Tofino after a vote conducted on social media, is being looked after at the Vancouver Aquarium's Marine Mammal Rescue Society, where she has grown from about two kilograms to more than three kilograms. Society executive director and head veterinarian Martin Haulena says Tofino is hitting many milestones in her recovery and growth, is eating well, and may transition from formula to solid food in a few weeks. Haulena says Tofino has shown interest in diving when placed in the water and has improved her swimming, manual dexterity and self-grooming. The pup was rescued alone near her namesake town on the west coast of Vancouver Island in mid-June. Haulena says while the pup's ultimate fate depends on Fisheries and Oceans Canada, orphaned otters are poor candidates for re-release because pups are typically taught how to survive in the wild by their mothers. "Otters are very, very dependent on their mom," Haulena says. "They learn a lot from their mom. They learn how to forage from their mom, learn where to forage, what to forage, how to use tools, how to dive and how to escape from predators. All (that) is very learned behaviour." Rescuers do not know what became of Tofino's mother but it is very unusual for pups to be abandoned. "Sea otter moms are meticulous and very caring mothers," Haulena says. "They are very responsive to their pups, so the assumption is — when there is an orphan pup — is that something bad has happened to mother." A sea otter pup rescued in 2020, a male nicknamed Joey, was eventually transferred from the rescue society to Vancouver Aquarium after 33 days of care and is still housed there. Haulena says the public attention on the rescue society generated by Tofino is the highest he has seen since Joey's rescue in 2020, and the society is seeking donations to support the cost of caring for the pup and other animals at the centre. He says the pup is no longer in critical condition, spending periods of 20 to 45 minutes in the water. "She's made a few attempts, but she can't dive yet. And that's very normal for a pup of her age, but in the next few weeks, I expect she will pick that up or certainly within the next month," Haulena says. He says she is "on track and doing well." "I've been doing this for a lot of years, and I know that things can go wrong. So I'm always a little bit cautious, but I'll describe it as cautiously optimistic at this point." This report by The Canadian Press was first published July 3, 2024. Chuck Chiang, The Canadian Press

organizations.name: ho-vancouver aquarium marine mammal rescue society
